alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Live Oak and northwestern Bee Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1244 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Esseville, or 8 miles southeast of Campbellton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Three Rivers, Nell, Oakville, Pawnee, Ray Point, Whitsett and Esseville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 64 and 83. US Highway 281 between mile markers 618 and 628. US Highway 181 near mile marker 572. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south Texas.
